com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app
Class SmartCommands.SimpleGuardedCommmand

java.lang.Object
  com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app.SmartCommands.GuardedCommand
      com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app.SmartCommands.SimpleGuardedCommmand
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
SmartCommands.ProgressDialogGuardedCommmand
Enclosing class:
SmartCommands
public abstract static class SmartCommands.SimpleGuardedCommmand
extends SmartCommands.GuardedCommand

A handy SmartCommands.GuardedCommand which will issue systematically a log when an exception occurs during the command execution, and will trigger a SmartCommands.GuardedException which wraps the original exception in that case.

Since:
2011.11.03

Constructor Detail

SmartCommands.SimpleGuardedCommmand

public SmartCommands.SimpleGuardedCommmand(android.content.Context context,

Same as SmartCommands.SimpleGuardedCommmand#SimpleGuardedCommmand(Context, String, String) with the last parameter equal to context.getString(warningDisplayMessageResourceId).

SmartCommands.SimpleGuardedCommmand

public SmartCommands.SimpleGuardedCommmand(android.content.Context context,
                                           java.lang.String warningLogMessage,
                                           java.lang.String warningDisplayMessage)
Creates a new SmartCommands.GuardedCommand, which will issue a warning log and then trigger a SmartCommands.GuardedException, if an exception occurs during its execution.

Parameters:
context - the Android context under which the commands is being run
warningLogMessage - the log message that will be output in case of exception
warningDisplayMessage - the (supposedly i18ned) human readable that will be transfered to the SmartCommands.GuardedException in case of exception during the command execution
Method Detail

handle

protected java.lang.Throwable handle(java.lang.Throwable throwable)
The implementation will log as a warning the exception, and return a SmartCommands.GuardedException which wraps the provided exception, with the warningDisplayMessage as message attribute.

Overrides:
handle in class SmartCommands.GuardedCommand
Parameters:
throwable - the exception that has been thrown during the SmartCommands.GuardedCommand.runGuarded() execution
Returns:
null if and only if the method has handled the exception and that the ActivityController.ExceptionHandler should not be invoked ; otherwise, the Throwable that should be submitted to the ActivityController.ExceptionHandler
See Also:
SmartCommands.GuardedCommand.handle(Throwable)
